attributes.philosophy-description: Let Black Cat Interiors help you fall in love with your space.
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Floor Plan Development, Decor Setup, Space Planning, Color & Finish Consulting, Lighting Design and Planning, Art Selection, Project Management, 3D Renderings, Product Sourcing & Procurement

attributes.philosophy-description: I believe that beautiful surroundings enhance the life and emotional well beings of those who live there. No matter how big or small the budget, interior decorating doesn't have to be complicated or inaccessible.
attributes.professional-bio: Annie is a keen visual artist and possesses strong sense of colors and skill to combine elements to create stunning design pieces. Equipped with degrees in Graphic Design and Advertising Communication, her interest expanded to Interior Design and it has become her main career obsession and passion. Her signature design esthetics are influenced by works from renowned designer including Dorothy Draper and Kelly Wearstler. Her works have won her numerous awards from leading publications and popular home decor blogs such as Metropolitan Home Magazine and Apartment Therapy. She has experience working with various clients in the midwest before she relocated to sunny California. She is also an avid fan of Hollywood and always keeps up with current trends and pop culture.
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Decor Setup, Floor Plan Development, Space Planning, Color & Finish Consulting, Lighting Design and Planning, Furniture & Material Selection, Art Selection, Home Staging, Product Sourcing & Procurement, Pet-Friendly Design, Kid-Friendly Design

attributes.philosophy-description: Felicia believes that spaces within in a home become a prime ingredient to a designers canvas. The space not only encompasses sounds and creates forms, but also inherits the sensual aesthetic characteristics of the elements within the space, every room within a home should encompass the other and become aesthetically pleasing.
attributes.professional-bio: In 2011 Felicia obtained her Bachelors degree from the CIDA Accredited Art Institute of Colorado. She has been actively in the design community doing Residential design. Felicia believes that Interiors should be a reflection of yourself but providing optimal functionality and overall sophistication. She has a passion for taking  pieces that already exist within a space and bringing in new and exciting ideas to make your room feel balanced and beautiful and as a mother with a growing family she highly believes that spaces should not only be beautiful but also functional.
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Floor Plan Development, Space Planning, Color & Finish Consulting, Bathroom and Kitchen Design, Furniture & Material Selection, Sustainable Design, Kid-Friendly Design

attributes.philosophy-description: Curating a thoughtful space in collaboration with my clients is always my goal. There's something so peaceful about an intentionally designed home, and often working in tandem elevates the design to the next level. I enjoy the push/pull of partnering with my clients to produce rooms and homes that speak to who they are and who they aspire to be.
attributes.professional-bio: After studying Interior Design at Oregon State University, Maryn took a sharp left turn to become a commercial advertising exec with a career path that took her to Los Angeles, Portland, and San Francisco. Her love for beautifully curated interiors brought her back to design while in San Francisco and from there she has worked with clients in SF, Portland, and Aspen to create well-thought personal spaces that they love to call home.
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Kid-Friendly Design, Project Management, Product Sourcing & Procurement, Home Staging, Art Selection, Event Design, Furniture & Material Selection, Bathroom and Kitchen Design, Color & Finish Consulting, Space Planning, Decor Setup, Floor Plan Development

attributes.philosophy-description:
The best interiors combine form and function in an effortless way.  Interior spaces should be a reflection of the heart and soul of those who dwell within them.

Working with clients to find the best solutions to meet their needs while creating spaces that speak for themselves.
attributes.certifications-description: BS Interior Design Colorado State University, IIDA Associate, Green Build Certified    Interior Design excellence in Visual Communications Award - 2007      Universal Design Residential Excellence Award, 2nd Place - 2006     Minted Editor's Choice Award - 2015     Rock-Ed Project Design Award - 2014
attributes.professional-bio:
Shelly Gerritsma received her Bachelor of Science degree from Colorado State University.  With a breadth of experience ranging from small scale commercial offices to multi-million dollar homes, Shelly brings her expertise to each project - finding design solutions that bring clients visions to life.  

Shelly's work has been featured in Southern Accents Magazine and various online publications.  She is an award winning designer, with accolades for a number of projects as well as visual communications in design.

With a philosophy that life is meant for living, Shelly creates interior spaces which remain beautiful long after they have been lived in.

In addition to interior design, Shelly has been a practicing illustrator and product designer, with her artwork and home goods available in various boutique shops and online marketplaces.
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Floor Plan Development, Decor Setup, Space Planning, Color & Finish Consulting, Bathroom and Kitchen Design, Custom Furniture Design, Furniture & Material Selection, Art Selection, Product Sourcing & Procurement, Home Staging, 3D Renderings, Kid-Friendly Design, Sustainable Design, Pet-Friendly Design, Construction Specification, Project Management, Architectural Planning

attributes.philosophy-description: Every projects has four elements: Something Rich, Something Rustic, Something Shiny and Something Glam.
attributes.aesthetic-description: Polished and relaxed... City meets surf, town meets country
attributes.professional-bio:
HGTV Design Star, STACEY COHEN, LEED AP is a Los Angeles-based interior design consultant.

Stacey merges her time spent in New York and Chicago with her Detroit upbringing into a unique style that lies between town and country, opulence and ease.  

Stacey studied Interior Architecture at Parson’s School of Design in New York and received her Bachelors Degree in Journalism from Columbia College Chicago.  Additionally, Stacey earned LEED AP accreditation and teaches Interior Design at FIDM in downtown Los Angeles.
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Floor Plan Development, Sustainable Design, Architectural Planning, Furniture & Material Selection, Space Planning, Decor Setup, Project Management, Custom Furniture Design, Bathroom and Kitchen Design, Lighting Design and Planning, Color & Finish Consulting, Art Selection, ADA Compliant, Home Staging, Product Sourcing & Procurement, 3D Renderings, Construction Specification, Pet-Friendly Design, Kid-Friendly Design

attributes.philosophy-description: The Curated Life is a full service design firm that is committed to providing artfully curated environments to meet our client’s needs based on form, function and budget. We believe that our homes are our refuge and should not only reflect a sense of style and beauty, but also function as a true living space. With an understanding of time and attention to detail, we will guide you along a journey to accomplish your design goals.
attributes.aesthetic-description: My design esthetic is driven by clean, simple lines, a mix of "old" and "new" with meaningful objects that reflect a sense of personality.

attributes.philosophy-description:
My passion is beauty.  It relaxes and revitalizes the soul to live in a space that you love.  As a result, no detail is ever left unattended - no matter how small.  

It is my philosophy to understand how my clients live and ensure that their spaces work for their lifestyle.  With this focus in mind, I love to create beautiful, classic interiors that  juxtapose modern and traditional elements.  Each and every fixture and finish is hand selected to withstand the test of time.  

I relish mixing high and low (in my wardrobe as well as my interiors!), so no matter your budget I can work with you to achieve the home of your dreams.
attributes.professional-bio:
**Selected by Architectural Digest editors as a finalist in their Living Room Design Challenge
**Featured curator on Chairish.com
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Home Staging, Product Sourcing & Procurement, Project Management, Kid-Friendly Design, Event Design, Art Selection, Furniture & Material Selection, Bathroom and Kitchen Design, Lighting Design and Planning, Color & Finish Consulting, Space Planning, Decor Setup, Floor Plan Development

attributes.philosophy-description: My philosophy is to not only create a beautiful space for my clients, but also a space that will be functional for their individual needs.  Each room should feel comfortable yet sophisticated.  I believe that every home has a story and my goal is to seek out the true character of the home through interior design.  This process should always be fun and at the pace of my clients.  I want each client to come out of this experience with a beautiful and functional space and no regrets!
attributes.certifications-description: NCIDQ Certification, 2012 Woman to Watch for Soiree Magazine, ASID Professional Member
attributes.professional-bio:
Lauren M. Creative was founded by Lauren Messina, a professional ASID interior designer in Charleston, South Carolina. Lauren studied and graduated with a Bachelor’s Degree in Interior Design from the University of Arkansas, and later successfully passed her NCIDQ Exam. She has over 14 years of interior design experience and offers a range of design services from new build and renovation specifications to space planning and decor. 
During the years, Lauren has had the pleasure of working with some of the most highly recognized interior designers in the country such as Tobi Fairley and Garry Mertins, and now prides herself in creating beautiful spaces with purpose in function. She was also recently recognized as one of Soirée Magazine’s Women to Watch and recently had the opportunity to co-design the 2012 Gifting Lounge of the Country Music Awards in Nashville, Tennessee.
With a proven sense of style and taste, Lauren has developed and collaborated on high end projects and events in South Carolina, Tennessee, Arkansas, New York and New Orleans. She has been involved in nationally recognized projects that have been featured in House Beautiful, Traditional Home, Brides Magazine as well as Grace Ormond Wedding Style along with various regional magazines throughout the country. She is also involved in her community through her continued service to the Junior League of Charleston, The Preservation Society of Charleston, The Gibbes Museum of Art and is Charleston Chapter President of Femfessionals.

attributes.philosophy-description: "I believe in doing the thing you feel is right. If it looks right, it is right." Dorothy Draper

attributes.display-name: Darlene Molnar, NCIDQ, LEED AP, Allied ASID
attributes.philosophy-description: As a boutique design firm we believe in developing shared visions with our clients and delivering tailored, modern environments that range from edgy and bold, to laid back and cozy.  Our approach to design often begins with an inspiring image, kicking off a careful selection of products that achieve a harmonious space.  We rely on laying colors, patterns, and textures to achieve a dynamic interior environment that is livable, fashionable, and functional.
attributes.aesthetic-description: Modern, Rustic, Contemporary, Vintage, Eclectic, Colorful
attributes.professional-bio:
Darlene opened her Washington DC office in December 2011 after several years experience with top-tier firms in the USA and UK.  She brings extensive knowledge and experience to every project.  Darlene is an NCIDQ Certified interior designer and LEED Accredited Professional with specialization in Interior Design & Construction.  She is an Allied Member and National Media Spokesperson for the American Society of Interior Designers.  

In 2012, Darlene was featured on HGTV and named a "Hot New Talent" by Home & Design Magazine.  In addition to her varied interior design experience, Darlene has designed products for Crate & Barrel and Umbra.  

Darlene's broad education includes Parsons New School of Design in Paris, Sotheby’s Institute of Art in London, and the Royal Academy in Copenhagen.  She holds a Master of Arts degree in Interior Design from the Corcoran College of Art & Design.  Darlene is currently an Adjunct Instructor in the Interior Architecture & Design Department at George Washington University.
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Floor Plan Development, Space Planning, Color & Finish Consulting, Lighting Design and Planning, Decor Setup, Bathroom and Kitchen Design, Furniture & Material Selection, Art Selection, Event Design, Sustainable Design, Kid-Friendly Design, Home Staging

attributes.philosophy-description:
Welcome to Zella Interiors!

I believe in creating happy spaces where you and your family will want to be.

Everyone’s style is different and their own, let me help you translate that into a space that represents you.
attributes.professional-bio:
I absolutely love interior design.  I’ve been drawing floor plans since I was 10 years old, always thinking about how my family would use each space.  I started working in the Architecture/Design Industry right out of high school.  I started as a drafter and worked my way up to designer and project manager.  With 8+ years experience in healthcare, I’ve discovered what environments make people simply feel good.  My passion has always been in residential design, so I decided to get involved with Laurel & Wolf and offer my services online.  I’m very excited to help families and individuals feel fantastic in their homes or work spaces!

I am a wife and mother of two small boys.  My design taste has expanded significantly since my kids came along.  I liked things very simple, with no knick knacks, and then my first son was born and I had to relinquish control of my small house to toys and various baby items.  I now thoroughly enjoy anything adult and sophisticated.  I like to combine fun pops of color with classic neutrals and understand the importance of organization and storage furniture.

attributes.philosophy-description: Creating beautiful, interesting spaces while bringing an easygoing and laid back style to the table.  This translates into a welcoming, comfortable space with unexpected details.

attributes.philosophy-description: The mission of MGK Interiors, LLC is to craft a space that reflects the client's unique personality and functions for their lifestyle.

attributes.philosophy-description: The mission of S. Farris & Co is to create spaces infused with a unique identity and spirit,  focusing on traditional furnishings and styles updated to engage the modern client. S. Farris values both craftsmanship and heritage in addition to the casual beauty that has become synonymous with California living.
attributes.certifications-description: Interior Design Certificate from UCLA Arc_ID.  Works featured on Houzz and Apartment Therapy.
attributes.professional-bio: Interior Designer Savannah Farris-Gilbert pulls from both her formal and organic education to inform her designs.  She draws heavily from her Los Angeles upbringing with an antique dealer/decorator mother and designer/builder father.  After receiving a BA from Fordham University, Savannah continued her scholarly pursuits in the Arc_ID program at UCLA where she honed her skills in space planning, rendering and design composition.  She has since worked in textiles, furniture manufacturing, and renovation in the private sector, in addition to her ongoing consulting and design projects.
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Floor Plan Development, Space Planning, Custom Furniture Design, Furniture & Material Selection, Art Selection, Project Management, Product Sourcing & Procurement, Home Staging

attributes.philosophy-description: My philosophy is to work with my clients to identify what styles they truly respond to and then expose them to complimentary ideas, giving them the most personally pleasing interior possible. I work to stay true to historic influences while introducing a contemporary element.
Everyone deserves a beautiful space to come home to, period.  I strive to create a one of a kind design for every client regardless of budget or project size.  Let me help you love where you live!
attributes.certifications-description: Graduated FIDM/Fashion Institute of Design & Merchandising Cum Laude
attributes.professional-bio:
Genessa was born and raised in a culturally diverse coastal community in beautiful Southern California.  She draws her inspiration from fashion, travel, music, dance, cooking, and all forms of art.  When she’s not working, you can find her out shopping for a bargain or cuddled up with a nice glass of wine.  Genessa loves dyi projects and isn’t afraid to get her hands dirty.  

Genessa began her design career after graduating with honors from an accelerated program at FIDM, where she acquired the tools she needed to be successful in the Interior Design field.  Post graduation she landed a position working for a high-end residential designer in the greater LA area where she continued to hone her skills.  Genessa just recently branched out on her own and is opening her own interior & event design studio.  She enjoys a challenge and specializes in a variety of design styles.  

Genessa is excited about expanding into e-Design because she’s able to help people who wouldn’t be able to hire a traditional designer.  Her philosophy is that everyone deserves a beautiful inviting space to come home to. 
 “I look forward to chatting with you and helping you turn your vision into a reality, let’s get started!” 

–	Genessa S.

attributes.philosophy-description: "By wisdom a house is built, and by understanding it is established; by knowledge the rooms are filled with all precious and pleasant riches" - Proverbs 24:3-4
attributes.professional-bio: After 17 years of creating art and obsessing over interiors, JaQuay's love to create grew organically into a desire to help people fall in love with their homes. Drawing upon her experience at Virginia Commonwealth University, as a Design Consultant, and as a Visual Merchandiser, she has honed her expertise and talent to help her clients identify their individual styles, understand their needs, and work within their budgets. With an aesthetic that is bold, yet refined, JaQuay's room designs are created to bring freshness, life, and energy into every household.
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Floor Plan Development, Art Selection, Home Staging, Decor Setup, Product Sourcing & Procurement, Color & Finish Consulting, Space Planning, Furniture & Material Selection, Kid-Friendly Design, Pet-Friendly Design

attributes.job-title: ISRP, Principal Designer, Perfect Piece Interiors
attributes.philosophy-description: It's what's inside that matters!  A space isn't just for looking at - it's for living in! Comfortably and Peacefully!
attributes.aesthetic-description: Traditional, Transitional, Vintage, Rustic, Romantic, French Country
attributes.professional-bio: "My love of Interior Design began in my Brooklyn, NY childhood home, where I re-arranged my mothers furniture and admired her 1970's red shag rug! Now, some 40 years later, that love has grown into a passion for designing beautiful, livable spaces that suite individual client needs. After formal education at Sheffield School of Interior Design in 2001, my passion only continued to grow to appreciate the many facets of residential design, and the impact a well designed space can make on those who dwell in it! In addition to residential Interiors, I am also Dual Certified as an International Staging and ReDesign Professional (ISRP). As Principal Interior Designer at Perfect Piece Interiors, I pride myself on making sure my clients needs are met!"
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Decor Setup, Space Planning, Floor Plan Development, Color & Finish Consulting, Lighting Design and Planning, Furniture & Material Selection, Art Selection, Custom Furniture Design, Bathroom and Kitchen Design, Kid-Friendly Design, 3D Renderings, Home Staging, Product Sourcing & Procurement, Project Management

attributes.philosophy-description: HERMOGENO DESIGNS’ holistic approach to design is one that carries through from one project to the next.  Each design uses high function as a foundation and is balanced with aesthetics to appeal to clients’ visual and sensory experiences.  Each of our projects are custom designed to satisfy that particular clients aesthetic style and use.  To ensure the end product matches our vision, HD uses the same team of industry professionals and artisans that work closely with the designer and the clients to unveil a space with no detail overlooked. Specializing in, but not limited to, full service Design-Build projects, HD's team includes architects, licensed & insured general & painting contractors, faux finisher/decorative painter and even custom fabricators of cabinetry, case good & wood furniture, upholstered seating, window treatments and soft goods that keep a consistent high level of detail work and service from one project to the next.
attributes.certifications-description:
WINDOW FASHIONS MAGAZINE 2008 ENVISION DESIGN COMPETITION
WONDERFUL WALLS CATEGORY; 2ND PLACE; MODERN POWDER ROOM

attributes.philosophy-description:
Everyone is different and people express their individuality from their style. My Goal is to express their style through their space, whether it their home or their office. The key to a successful design is to carefully listen to what your client wants and needs to create the home/office of their dream. creating a functional, unique and sophisticated space for my client is my goal. Your style and class will shine through your space, trust me. 




"I'm going to make everything around me beautiful- that will be my Life" -Elsie De Wolfe
attributes.aesthetic-description: transitional, Classy, Glam, Contemporary, Light and bright
attributes.professional-bio: I have earned my Bachelor of Fine Art’s degrees in Interior Design from Moore College of Art and Design in Philadelphia PA. During my time in school, I interned at various interior design firms. This experience broadened my knowledge with the practicalities of remodeling and thus impacted my design decisions. I am driven and ambitious, and I don't quit when the challenge get tough. I have skills in floor plan drawing, rendering and 3D modeling. Designing is my passion and I'm always thinking two steps ahead. My main focus and goal is to design a space that my clients love and are excited to be in.  designing is my life and I wouldn't have it any other way.
attributes.areas-of-specialty: Floor Plan Development, Decor Setup, Space Planning, Color & Finish Consulting, Bathroom and Kitchen Design, Furniture & Material Selection, Sustainable Design, Kid-Friendly Design, Pet-Friendly Design, 3D Renderings

attributes.location: Phoenix, AZ.  Corona Del Mar, CA.
attributes.philosophy-description: I believe that being surrounded by beautiful objects while doing everyday tasks can bring joy to some otherwise mundane moments. I believe that our environment has one of the greatest impacts on our happiness, I believe in color + pattern, but most of all I believe that “Luxury is a lifestyle and not a price tag.”
attributes.professional-bio:
I hold a degree in Interior Design and have been a professional interior designer for over 23 years. I have decorated and renovated some of the finest homes in Chicago, Minneapolis, Arizona, and Santa Barbara. Being a designer and an entrepreneur led me to start my company Lifestyle Duchess in 2011.” Lifestyle” because it is a passion of mine and if you have ever seen one of my appearances on ABC’s Sonoran Living Live you probably know that I live with a zest for life, like to entertain with style and enjoy teaching  people how to put effort into their world and home. Nothing brings me more joy and satisfaction then to see my clients reactions to their homes. 
I recently had the great honor of having received an invitation to BOLD Summit 2015, which is the largest design event held for luxury interior designers and top movers and shakers in our industry!
